metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8904 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Xen through 4.8.x mishandles the "contains segment descriptors" property during GNTTABOP_transfer (aka guest transfer) operations, which might allow PV guest OS users to execute arbitrary code on the host OS, aka XSA-214.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8904` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.6 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
libxenstore3.0 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-hypervisor-4.5-amd64 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-hypervisor-4.5-arm64 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-hypervisor-4.5-armhf - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-hypervisor-4.6-amd64 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-hypervisor-4.6-arm64 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-hypervisor-4.6-armhf - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-system-amd64 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1
xen-system-arm64 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.1

No subscription required
